intro: Seseli scariosum, commonly known as the scarious seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive silvery or grayish underside that gives it a unique appearance. Seseli scariosum is often found in alpine or subalpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
